original_title: Sri Lanka’s BoI signs deal for cable car system
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Board of Investment has signed an agreement to develop a cable car system in the country.

“Sri Lanka’s First Cable Car Experience! Amber Adventure signed an agreement for 4.5 million US dollars, in collaboration with Ambuluwawa Bio Diversity Center, and technical and product expertise from China Machine-Building International Corporation,” the BoI said on X (twitter).
Several proposed cable car systems in various parts of the island have not materialized so far.
In 2019 Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers gave initial clearance for a cable car project in the hill country town of Nuwara Eliya.

Sri Lanka is targeting 2.3 million tourists in 2024 with India, Russia, China, the United Kingdom and Germany expected to bring most of the arrivals, Chairman of the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA), Priyantha Fernando said.
Tourist authorities are promoting the country internationally including through the use of social media influencers.
Sri Lanka needs to sell a product that attracts high spending tourists, President Ranil Wickremesinghe said speaking at an event earlier this week.

“We are going to market Sri Lanka in a way that you can’t think possible,” he said. “So we will have to re-think our tourist policies,” Wickremesinghe said. “So lets work on them and learn how to market them.” (Colombo/Nov29/2023)
